summary_gpt: Infosys Limited announced its participation in multiple investor meetings, including roadshows and conferences across various global locations from May to June 2025, to engage with investors and analysts. The company also shared that details of these events will be available on its website.

Infosys Limited's subsidiary, BASE Life Sciences A/S, transferred its entire stake in BASE Life Sciences Inc. to Infosys BPM UK Limited to improve operational efficiency and expand market presence. The restructuring is an internal transfer aimed at streamlining business operations.

Infosys has completed the acquisition of Australian cybersecurity firm The Missing Link, enhancing its cybersecurity offerings and presence in the Australian market. The deal aims to strengthen Infosys' end-to-end cybersecurity solutions and global client services.
Infosys Limited has issued newspaper advertisements in English and Kannada regarding the loss of share certificates, which will also be available on their website.

Infosys has completed its acquisition of MRE Consulting, a leader in energy trading and risk management solutions, to strengthen its capabilities in the energy sector's digital transformation. This strategic move aims to enhance Infosys's offerings in energy and commodity trading, leveraging MRE's expertise and client base.

Infosys announced a strategic collaboration with Yorkshire Building Society to accelerate its digital transformation, focusing on delivering a mobile-first, data-enabled banking experience leveraging cloud, AI, and cybersecurity solutions. The partnership aims to modernize operations, enhance customer experience, and support Yorkshire Building Society's 2030 strategic goals.

Infosys announced the launch of Infosys Topaz for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, an AI-first suite designed to accelerate SAP S/4HANA Cloud adoption, reimagine business transformation, and unlock data value for enterprises. The suite leverages generative AI and Infosys' cloud offerings to enhance efficiency, reduce costs, and enable future-ready architecture for clients across industries.

Infosys Foundation announced the fourth edition of its Aarohan Social Innovation Awards, committing INR 2 crore to support social innovators across India in education, healthcare, and environmental sustainability. The awards aim to recognize technology-based solutions that address social challenges and have scalable impact.
